result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin L. Figures was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Quentin L. Figures is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Quentin L. Figures was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentences/cases but concurrent with 15CF157.

miscConds.notes: Any/all evaluations/counseling as deemed necessary/appropriate by DOC.

records.addlTxt: Bond Hearing - 10/20/2015

09:41 AM Defendant Quentin L. Figures in court with attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja.  Defendant Quentin L. Figures in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quentin L. Figures appeared by video.  Defendant wishes to proceed to plea and sentencing today via video.   Defendant formally waives right to be present at sentencing.   State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 2: dismissed.  Ct 1:  amend to Misd BJ:  W/H 18 mo probation, consecutive to existing cases/sentences; no contact with victim in 15CF157; any evaluations/counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC; costs waived.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Guilty plea given/entered.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2020 at 09:30 am.

01:19 PM Attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja in court via phone.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises there is a settlement in 15CF157, jury trial to be removed from calendar.  Request to set for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2020 at 09:30 am.
Telephone conference on December 6, 2019 at 11:00 am.

09:45 AM Defendant Quentin L. Figures in court, via phone, with attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja.  Defendant Quentin L. Figures in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has filed motion for reconsideration.  State will file response.  Next hearing will be deadline for decision.  Defendant waives right to be here in person for arraingment.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.    Waiver of formal reading of information.    Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Telephone conference scheduled for December 6, 2019 at 11:00 am.

DA Allen appears for State.  Atty Jeff Ocwieja appears with Quentin Figures, who is in custody.  Court reviews the motion.  Atty Ocwieja comments.  Response by DA Allen.  Argument by Atty Ocwieja in regards to Wisconsin statutes 969.02 and 969.03.  Parties have not found case law that is on point.  Court reads opinion of Atty General.  Quentin Figures addresses court.  DA Allen addresses court.  Atty Ocwieja addresses court.  Court takes recess.  Adjourn to 2:50 pm. 3:18 PM, back on record.  Court hears DA Allen on 969.02(5) and 969.03(3).  Response by Atty Ocwieja.  Video adjournment to July 12, 2019 at 10:00 am.  Arraignment also set for July 12, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Quentin Figures is brought to court by law enforcement.  There is an allegation that the defendant has been in violation of no contact order.  Atty Reimann denies any further violation of any law and objects to the arrest of the defendant today.  He also objects to any bond based on no criminal complaint filed.  ADA Allen responds, gives court an overview of report of violation.
